title: Production Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Columbia College Chicago (Chicago, IL) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: After a short phone conversation I was brought in to interview with two staff members. They asked some of the standard questions and we ended up having a robust conversation around the department, their expectations, and challenges for the coming year. It was relaxed and a good experience.
Interview Questions: Describe a time that you improved the operations of a company or production.

title: Fashion Visual Arts Team Member  Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Columbia College Chicago
Interview Descriptions: Describing examples of past visual merchandising experience. Asked what you could bring to the role or contribute as a teammate. The interview was done on zoom, and the process was fairly easy.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with visual merchandising

title: Architerural Designer Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Columbia College Chicago
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very relaxed and not tense at all. The interviewer was nice and made me feel very comfortable. It was my first interview ever and I was nervous but the interview went more like a conversation
Interview Questions:
what are your straights?
what are your weaknesses?
How do you prioritize your tasks?
Have you made any mistakes that compromised someone else?

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Columbia College Chicago in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Initial phone call
An hour-long interview with team members
Then, an hour-long third interview with the department and several professors.
I received no response from the university for two weeks. I finally emailed them to ask for a status update, and received a generic cut-paste rejection email.
Interview Questions: How do you see the future of higher education?

title: Recorder Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Columbia College Chicago
Interview Descriptions: The interview process overall went very quickly.  Once I submitted my resume,  I received a phone call shortly after, and an interview was set up with the actual interviewer.  During the phone call, a lot of the detail surrounding the position was discussed ahead of time which allowed me the ability to think about the job and a number of questions I could ask during the interview.  It was very organized and had an easy flow.
Interview Questions: Very good questions relating to the position as to what I had mentioned in my resume, and also what I could bring to the job.  They had a project they were working on and thought some of the experience would benefit their team.

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Columbia College Chicago
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty average. The response time was nice and quick. The people there were all very nice, and made the interview process enjoyable. They were very informative, leaving me with almost little to know questions about company culture/the work done there.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience being a mentor to someone?

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Columbia College Chicago
Interview Descriptions: Quick interview process. There was a phone interview. There was a in person interview with team members. Then a final interview with manager. The process was easy and a seamless process. It helps to know people who already work there.
Interview Questions: Talk about your experience

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Columbia College Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very informal and approachable. It really ended up flowing more like a conversation about my interests and history in the department and at Columbia. I would have stayed longer to chat with the man who was hiring but someone else was in line behind me for their interview.
Interview Questions: What is my experience and comfort level with the medium?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Columbia College Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions:
First was phone interview, then met in person two members of the department, & felt positive after leaving.  Got a call a week later that they wanted me to come in again to meet head of the department and other important faculty members.  I met one new member of the department who cut me off after answering her questions and put me down after reading my experience & background.  When that woman walked me back to my main interviewer she ignored me as I said thank you so much, nice meeting you.  
They said they would let me know if it would move forward or not by the next week & no call at all. 
So unprofessional & rude I should not have wasted my time & effort.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Columbia

title: Resident Assistant (RA) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Columbia College Chicago in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Prior to applying you must attend and informational session discussing the job.
Apply online.
Have a group interview where you interact with the other candidates in a series of tasks like building a tower out of marshmallows and spaghetti but each person has a specific role.
After the group interview you will have a personal interview with a current RA and one of the professional staff.
You will hear back from them in a couple of months since they hire a year prior to the job
Interview Questions: What was a time that you overcame a difficult situation regarding a co-worker / teammate.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Columbia College Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Primarily focused on my learning more about my background, the goals I would like to achieve within the office if hired, and the importance of diversity of inclusion in my life.
Interview Questions: What is the significance of diversity and inclusion within your own life?

title: Site Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Columbia College Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: I initially received a phone interview. This was followed by a in person interview.  I called back a couple of days after the phone interview and was offered the job.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weekness?

title: Creative Writing Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Columbia College Chicago
Interview Descriptions: No interview process, you just have to get A's in all your core Creative Writing classes and apply. It's pretty easy to get into and the professors are always looking to hire new tutors. (At least, they were when I was there.) As long as you work hard and show your professors that you're a good student and writer, you'll probably get in.
Interview Questions: There were no interview questions.

title: Maintenance Lead Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Columbia College Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Had 2 interviews with a 3 person panel of Dept. managers. Very relaxed, well-informed questions. Good concise information about the college and what was expected from the job. No HR people involved in the initial interviews.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time in your previous employment when you resolved a conflict.

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Columbia College Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview phase - Generally ask you a lot of questions about your skillset and what you're looking for in a company. I was asked a lot of scenario questions related to students, in an in-person interview easy to talk about, over the phone hard to get a sense of if the person on the other end's relating to your explanation of the question.
Interview Questions: What are you looking for in the Columbia culture?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Columbia College Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: I got a phone call asking if I would like the job. I talked with the supervisor for a little while as she explained the job and the job hiring process.
Interview Questions: Do you want this job

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Columbia College Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Apply online; meet within few weeks; start as soon as the very next week; lenient requirements, so many apply and are hired; one on one interview with your immediate supervisor, thoroughly discusses and lays out requirements, very accommodating in gauging your availability and helping meet with you on making the position achievable
Interview Questions: How much experience do you have with customer service?

title: Support Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Columbia College Chicago (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Practices have changed and my hiring and interview process is now out of date. It was fair and inclusive. The hiring manager carefully sought a good-fit with the position's clients.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult or unexpected questions.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Columbia College Chicago in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: One phone interview. One in-person interview with the hiring manager and team. And a second interview with the department head. Very casual. Most of the team was out and that didn't seem to affect the decision.
Interview Questions: What's your favorite musician (not a music-related job)

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Columbia College Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Sat one on one with the Coordinator of Operations, who made me feel very comfortable and a memorable personality filled with kindness and professionalism. She introduced me to other directors and was very organized with her questions she wanted to ask me.
Interview Questions:
What kind of hours are you looking for?
Why do I want to work for the LS?
How do you handle difficult people?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Columbia College Chicago in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very informal.  I sat down with the person who would be my direct supervisor and his counterpart.  It was really just a discussion of what I've done in my career.  Later I was called in to meet with the direct supervisor and his supervisor.  Again, the same thing.  I was offered the job a few weeks later.
Interview Questions: They didn't seem very well versed in interviewing techniques and didn't ask any really thought provoking questions in the interview.  There were no unexpected questions.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Columbia College Chicago in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Basic Interview
All student workers get a set hourly wage at the same rate. 
Depending on area of department, it may be a software test which is super easy.
You dont get hired, you may be asked back to work during finals so don't feel as if all is lost.
Interview Questions: There really wasn't any difficult questions and all software tests are based on the basics.

title: Computer Lab Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Columbia College Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was sat down in an office and my experience was questioned by multiple people who were managers. They were fairly nice and it seemed like they'd already decided they were going to hire me before the interview even started. The application had all the relevant questions, the interview was mostly to guage my personality and character to make sure I was a fit as they already knew my skills.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Columbia College Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: One on one with the person in the department who did the hiring and also the person who did the class scheduling.Then they told me what I would be teaching and I said, "ok, thanks!"
Interview Questions:
Experience in teaching? 
Approach to teaching?

title: Adjunct Faculty - FIlm & Video Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Columbia College Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: The school has made the shift to hiring only individuals with a Master's Degree or better. Their preference is for experience, whether through local industry opportunities or from the national level. Typically, you must meet with a department leader, then a committee, then another individual higher up, and possibly make a presentation to a class and yet another committee.
Interview Questions: This can depend upon who is on your committee, but the most difficult typically has to do with dealing with students who can be extremely difficult for any number and variety of personal reasons.

title: Junior Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Columbia College Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: The people there were easy to communicate with making the work there easier to do the work that was required.
Interview Questions: What is your asking price range for salary?

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Columbia College Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was initially scouted by a full time faculty member. I was hired on his recommendation only. After one semester all adjunct faculty go through an evaluation process. This involves a review of syllabus and all course materials.  It also includes an in class observation by a full time faculty member. Finally there is a meeting with the chair of the department.
Interview Questions: Nothing really.

Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Columbia College Chicago (Chicago, IL) in Dec 2009
Interview Descriptions: Phone then on line video (preSkype)
Interview Questions: WHat majors would you cut in the program?
